data.title: CAAM
data.meta_description: Queen of Jazz, Lady Ella, First Lady of Song. Born in Newport News, Virginia on April 25, 1917, Ella Jane Fitzgerald had a difficult coming of age in New York City various uptowns—Westchester and Harlem but also a Bronx reformatory and what was then called a "Training School for Girls" in the upper Hudson Valley. Throughout her trials—her mother died when she 15 and she may have been abused by her stepfather—she nurtured a love for music, especially jazz, training her vocal instrument against the hits of her youth and the standards of her Methodist church and Sunday school...
